info.title: Enate
info.description: Enate Connector allows seamless integration with Enateâ€™s enterprise workflow engine. It allows to get work from the Enate platform, edit the data and add/download files.  We can also create new work items on the Enate platform using these actions of the Enate connector.

FullCasePacket.description: All data about a Case Packet.

EndDate.description: The date/time that the Packet was Closed.

CustomerGUID.description: The unique identifier of the Customer that the Packet is for.

ContractGUID.description: The unique identifier of the Contract between the Customer and Supplier that this Packet is transacting under.

ServiceGUID.description: The unique identifier of the Service under the Contract that this Packet is for.

ServiceLineGUID.description: The unique identifier of the Service Line that this Packet is for.

ResolvedByUser.description: The User that resolved the Packet.

Files.description: The list of Files associated with this group of Packets.

Contacts.description: The list of Contacts associated with this group of Packets.

Defects.description: The list of Defects associated with this group of Packets.

StartDate.description: The date/time that the Packet was created.

CustomerName.description: The name of the Customer that the Packet is for.

ContractName.description: The name of the Contract between the Customer and Supplier that this Packet is transacting under.

ServiceName.description: The name of the Service under the Contract that this Packet is for.

ServiceLineName.description: The name of the Service Line that this Packet is for.

ProcessTypeName.description: The name of the Process Type within the Service Line that this Packet is for.

Reference.description: The unique and human-readable reference of the Packet.

LastUpdatedByUserOn.description: The date/time that the Packet was updated by the User identified in <seealso cref="P:Enate.Core.Contracts.DTOs.BaseFullPacket.LastUpdatedByUser" />.

DueDate.description: The date/time that the Packet is currently due to be Resolved to meet SLA.

ResolvedOn.description: The date/time that the Packet was Resolved.

OwnerUser.description: The User that is currently responsible for the Packet even if it is not currently assigned to them to work on.

x-enum-metadata.Description: Rejected due to no configured email address matching recipient address

UserForList.description: Basic details of a user as shown in Enate GUI.

HasProfilePicture.description: Does the user have a profile picture available.

IsMe.description: Identifies if the User represents the currently authenticated User.

ExistingPacketFile.description: Details of a file attached to a Packet either directly or via Email.

Note.description: A note to describe the File.

Tags.description: A collection of Tags to attribute to the new File.

LastUpdatedOn.description: The date/time that the File was added or had it's metadata updated by the User identified in <seealso cref="P:Enate.Core.Contracts.DTOs.ExistingPacketFile.LastUpdatedByUser" />.

LastUpdatedByUser.description: The User that added the file or most recently updated it's metadata.

Packet.description: The Packet that the Email is associated with when {Enate.Core.Contracts.DTOs.ExistingPacketFile.Source} is {Enate.Core.Contracts.Enumerations.PacketFileSource.EmailAttachment}.

ExistingPacketContact.description: Details of a contact attached to a Packet.

AddedOn.description: The date/time that the Contact was added by the User identified in <seealso cref="P:Enate.Core.Contracts.DTOs.ExistingPacketContact.AddedByUser" />.

AddedByUser.description: The User that added the Contact.

HasProfilePicture.description: Does the user have a profile picture available.

IsMe.description: Identifies if the User represents the currently authenticated User.

ExistingPacketDefect.description: Details of a defect attached to a Packet.

Packet.description: The Packet that the Defect is associated with.

AddedOn.description: The date/time that the Defect was added by the User identified in <seealso cref="P:Enate.Core.Contracts.DTOs.ExistingPacketDefect.AddedByUser" />.

AddedByUser.description: The User that added the Defect.

AffectedRecordCount.description: The number of records affected by the Defect.

Resolved.description: Indicates if the Defect has been resolved or not.
